### The 1% Treaty

**Redirect $27B/year from the War on Humanity to the War on Disease**

Every nation redirects just **1%** of their current murder budget to fund hyper-efficient decentralized clinical trials that pay patients to participate.

We'd still have $2.69 trillion left for war and bombs and stuff. $2.69 trillion is enough to murder everyone on Earth 67 times. (Literally.)

### The DIH Treasury

Instead of a committee of 200 bureaucrats picking winners, the DIH treasury directly subsidizes patients in the dFDA marketplace, letting them choose which trials to fund. The power of global collective intelligence decides.

### The Decentralized FDA

**Amazon for Clinical Trials + Consumer Reports for Drugs**

The dFDA achieves **82X cost reduction** through decentralized pragmatic trials. Patients can search treatments ranked by real-world effectiveness and join trials with one click.

**Outcome Labels: Nutrition Facts for Drugs**

Food has nutrition labels. Cigarettes have warning labels. Drugs have... incomprehensible 40-page inserts written by lawyers having seizures.

The dFDA fixes that with **Outcome Labels** - simple, data-driven summaries showing exactly what happens when real people try a treatment:

![Outcome Labels Example](assets/dfda-outcome-labels.png)

Based on thousands of real patients, you see:
- **Cognitive Improvements**: Memory +35%, Executive Function +22%
- **Side Effects**: Headache +9%, Fatigue +7%
- **The Truth**: Not marketing claims, actual measured effects from real humans

Just like nutrition labels transformed food transparency, outcome labels will transform medical transparency. No more guessing. No more 40-page legal documents. Just clear data about what actually happens.

**Treatment Rankings: Consumer Reports for Drugs**

Current system: Your doctor guesses which treatment might work based on one pharma lunch presentation from 2003.

dFDA system: Type your condition, see every treatment ranked by real-world effectiveness:

![Treatment Rankings Example](assets/dfda-comparative-effectiveness-ranking-search.png)
